title: 104_s1019
content: Whirling Disease Response Act of 1995 - Requires the Director of the United States Fish and Wildlife Service to submit preliminary and final reports to the Committee on Environment and Public Works of the Senate and the Committee on Resources of the House of Representatives concerning whirling fish disease and other fish parasites and pathogens. Directs the United States Fish and Wildlife Service to make funds available to: (1) the Fish Technology Center in Bozeman, Montana. And (2) State, local, and private entities for cooperative studies of whirling disease at such center. Authorizes appropriations.
